intro: Erigeron leucanthus, commonly known as white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features showy white ray flowers surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in dry, open habitats like prairies and roadsides. Erigeron leucanthus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
